commit_message:
Disable mariadb mysql history client logging

Environment variable MYSQL_HISTFILE is added to mariadb container
to disable storing client mysql history to ~/.mysql_history file.

Change-Id: Ie95bc1f830fbf34d30c73de07513299115d8e8c5

subject: Correctly handle missing RabbitMQ queues
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-05 09:44:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/f066c6df75aee197b80053650284eb898505b5d3', 'message': "Correctly handle missing RabbitMQ queues

Currently, setting the '[oslo_messaging] direct_mandatory_flag' config
option to 'True' (the default) will result in a 'MessageUndeliverable'
exception being raised when sending a reply if a RabbitMQ queue is
missing [1]. It was the responsibility of the application to handle
this exception, however, many applications are not doing so. This has
resulted in a number of bug reports.

Start handling this error condition, using a retry loop to attempt to
resend the message and work around any temporary glitches. Since
attempting to send a reply will will no longer raise an exception,
there is little benefit in retaining the '[oslo_messaging]
direct_mandatory_flag' config option: users setting this to False will
simply not benefit from the retry logic and improved logging added
here. This option is already deprecated though and will be fully
removed in a future release.

[1] https://www.rabbitmq.com/channels.html

Change-Id: Id5cddbefbe24ef100f1cc522f44430df77d217cb
Closes-Bug: #1905965
(cherry picked from commit 4937949dffecdf8863a7876e5a6b0b18e811c3ac)
(cherry picked from commit 391ce7fc69adc8d713d8ca64e76d901eb3e65df1)
(cherry picked from commit 36b5e06c92337cd04d1c8ae4840dbc224faeaa9f)

exception being raised when sending a reply if a RabbitMQ queue is
missing [1]. It was the responsibility of the application to handle
this exception, however, many applications are not doing so. This has
resulted in a number of bug reports.

Start handling this error condition, using a retry loop to attempt to
resend the message and work around any temporary glitches. Since
attempting to send a reply will will no longer raise an exception,
there is little benefit in retaining the '[oslo_messaging]
direct_mandatory_flag' config option: users setting this to False will
simply not benefit from the retry logic and improved logging added
here. This option is already deprecated though and will be fully
removed in a future release.

[1] https://www.rabbitmq.com/channels.html

Change-Id: Id5cddbefbe24ef100f1cc522f44430df77d217cb
Closes-Bug: #1905965
(cherry picked from commit 4937949dffecdf8863a7876e5a6b0b18e811c3ac)
(cherry picked from commit 391ce7fc69adc8d713d8ca64e76d901eb3e65df1)
(cherry picked from commit 36b5e06c92337cd04d1c8ae4840dbc224faeaa9f)
"}]
commit_message:
Correctly handle missing RabbitMQ queues

Currently, setting the '[oslo_messaging] direct_mandatory_flag' config
option to 'True' (the default) will result in a 'MessageUndeliverable'
exception being raised when sending a reply if a RabbitMQ queue is
missing [1]. It was the responsibility of the application to handle
this exception, however, many applications are not doing so. This has
resulted in a number of bug reports.

Start handling this error condition, using a retry loop to attempt to
resend the message and work around any temporary glitches. Since
attempting to send a reply will will no longer raise an exception,
there is little benefit in retaining the '[oslo_messaging]
direct_mandatory_flag' config option: users setting this to False will
simply not benefit from the retry logic and improved logging added
here. This option is already deprecated though and will be fully
removed in a future release.

[1] https://www.rabbitmq.com/channels.html

Change-Id: Id5cddbefbe24ef100f1cc522f44430df77d217cb
Closes-Bug: #1905965
(cherry picked from commit 4937949dffecdf8863a7876e5a6b0b18e811c3ac)
(cherry picked from commit 391ce7fc69adc8d713d8ca64e76d901eb3e65df1)
(cherry picked from commit 36b5e06c92337cd04d1c8ae4840dbc224faeaa9f)

added_lines: 'MessageUndeliverable exception will be used to loop for a ' 'timeout to lets a chance to sender to recover.'

commit_message:
Add Octavia use of the rsyslog image

Octavia is adding a container to collect logs from inside the
amphora instances. This patch adds Octavia to the list of services
leveraging the existing rsyslog container.

commit_message:
Add support for Octavia amphora log offloading

This patch configures Octavia to enable amphora log offloading
to the Octavia rsyslog container if the OctaviaOffloadAllLogs
parameter is True.

Note: this is a semantic backport of
Ic4ee6f4a150200531491cdd78ca3c4f66e5d1ffb.

Conflicts:
  playbooks/octavia-files.yaml

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/761405

(cherry picked from commit c5c57f562094e698e0bc47fafd0cc6ec70bb15b6)

commit_message:
[stable-only] gate: Pin CEPH_RELEASE to nautilus in LM hook

I1edd5a50079f325fa143a7e0d51b3aa3bb5ed45d moved the branchless
devstack-plugin-ceph project to the Octopus release of Ceph that drops
support for py2. As this was still the default on stable/train this
breaks the nova-live-migration and nova-grenade jobs.

This change works around this by pinning the CEPH_RELEASE to nautilus
within the LM hook as was previously used prior to the above landing.

Note that the devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest job from the plugin repo
continues to pass as it is correctly pinned to the Luminous release that
supports py2.

If anything the above enforces the need to move away from these hook
scripts and instead inherit our base ceph jobs from this repo in the
future to avoid the Ceph release jumping around like this.

Change-Id: I1d029ebe78b16ed2d4345201b515baf3701533d5
(cherry picked from commit ff570d1b4e9b9777405ae75cc09eae2ce255bf19)
(cherry picked from commit 436e8172f65193e177a4a12780f752dbc7e88b39)
(cherry picked from commit 238c83a2f778a9c2f0abbe318dda97b715926565)
(cherry picked from commit 5aa7f3b4e6241e21c69dc103bb7be847b500429c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/52/780852/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(lyarwood): Pin the CEPH_RELEASE to nautilus here as was the case # prior to https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/+/777232 # landing in the branchless plugin, we also have to pin in ceph.sh when # configuring ceph on a remote node via ansible. export CEPH_RELEASE=nautilus

commit_message:
Disable Docker iptables and bridge networking by default

In I165199fc98fb98f227f2a20284e1bab03ef65b5b and
Ic745300b27e50132d80d03787fa4abfada2d0173 we provided flags to disable
Docker's control of iptables and bridge networking respectively. The
original behaviour was maintained for backwards compatibility, to allow
the patches to be backported.

This patch changes the default behaviour to disable the manipulation of
iptables and disabling bridge networking.

Related-Bug: #1849275
Related-Bug: #1848249

commit_message:
Add support for Octavia amphora log offloading

This patch configures Octavia to enable amphora log offloading
to the Octavia rsyslog container if the OctaviaOffloadAllLogs
parameter is True.

Note: this is a semantic backport of
Ic4ee6f4a150200531491cdd78ca3c4f66e5d1ffb. It also contains a queens
only modification to pass the enable_log_offloading variable through
mistral.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/761454
Change-Id: Ie39e14cbfde647224af509267896bd36ffffc4f2
(cherry picked from commit c5c57f562094e698e0bc47fafd0cc6ec70bb15b6)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/62/761462/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: module(load="imudp") input(type="imudp" address="{{ mgmt_port_ip }}" port="514") # Output the amphora tenant traffic flow logs if ($inputname == "imudp" and $syslogfacility-text == "local0" and $syslogseverity-text == "info" and $hostname startswith "amphora") then { action(type="omfile" FileCreateMode="0644" File="/var/log/octavia/octavia-tenant-traffic.log") stop } # Output the amphora administrative logs if ($inputname == "imudp" and $syslogfacility-text == "local1" and $hostname startswith "amphora") then { action(type="omfile" FileCreateMode="0644" File="/var/log/octavia/octavia-amphora.log") stop }

commit_message:
Allow octavia container image version to be parameterized.

We are working on a testing stable OOO deployments against arbitrary
versions of octavia (master for the time being).

Note: This "sort of works". The puppet configuration step fails as it
appears to use the puppet version in the container image - not the one
installed on the host. It was expected that the puppet would still be
whatever the branch-under-test version was and therfore would match the
tht's. Unfortunately, doesn't seem to be the cast atm

Change-Id: I4d17b0f05f9d58380952dc5d0e60e807113860b9

commit_message:
Create a job for testing Octavia train against queens/rocky/stein.

We are working on a testing older stable OOO deployments against train
Octavia.

Note: we "pinned" to Octavia train because of python 3 related naming
issues.

Depends-On: I6ef4b290fb5bc6d9fcf7b240fa97a5dbb0e7f88d
Depends-On: I1e2603d7395440ff2f97c69fa92947a397f71446

commit_message:
Make image metadef tests admin-only

Test the image metadef API with admin credentials, which is really
how they should be deployed anyway. Glance is moving to make this the
default policy, so tempest needs to do the same.

Related-Bug: #1916926
Change-Id: Ie284e87236191f91f388fb1530db9881cca338b8

commit_message:
Make some metadef operations admin-only

This restricts all metadef resource manipulation to admin-only, but
still allow users to see everything. There are multiple low-grade
security issues with the metadef API, detailed in the related bug.
Restricting resource manipulation to admin-only solves most of these
concerns.

SecurityImpact
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/780108
Change-Id: I333c58e73c202c1f523030e54e03f2868459b595
Related-Bug: #1916926

commit_message:
[stable-only] Specify IPv6 CIDR in tempest-slow-py3

This is a copy of a neutron patch [1] which specifies the CIDR used by
the public network in the tempest-slow-py3 job.

The original bug [2] was fixed in tempest [3] but since devstack pins
TEMPEST_BRANCH=26.0.0 for stable/stein, we must do a one-off fix
in-tree to fix our job.

Related-Bug: #1914037

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/777389
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1914037
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/774764

Change-Id: I8b559084ac424a868a3a3b387fc51bf056dbd3df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/91/780991/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: vars: devstack_localrc: # To workaround https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1914037 # tempest is pinned to 26.0.0 on stable/stein in devstack, so # we cannot consume the tempest fix. IPV6_PUBLIC_RANGE: 2001:db8:0:10::/64 IPV6_PUBLIC_NETWORK_GATEWAY: 2001:db8:0:10::2 IPV6_ROUTER_GW_IP: 2001:db8:0:10::1 vars: devstack_localrc: # To workaround https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1914037 # tempest is pinned to 26.0.0 on stable/stein in devstack, so # we cannot consume the tempest fix. IPV6_PUBLIC_RANGE: 2001:db8:0:10::/64 IPV6_PUBLIC_NETWORK_GATEWAY: 2001:db8:0:10::2 IPV6_ROUTER_GW_IP: 2001:db8:0:10::1

commit_message:
pci: Add vDPA vnic to PCI request mapping and filtering

This change extend the vnic type to PCI request dev type mapping to
support the vDPA vnic type.

This change extends the PCI stats module to filter out VDPA 'dev_type'
pools if its not explicitly requested.

This change explicitly filters out the vDPA dev_type from the pci alias
schema since that is not supported.

Blueprint: libvirt-vdpa-support
Change-Id: I91dd7993395f693c7d26c1caa44fa365f5cbec12
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/50/778350/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: elif pci_dev.dev_type in ( fields.PciDeviceType.SRIOV_VF, fields.PciDeviceType.VDPA): def _filter_pools_for_unrequested_vdpa_devices(cls, pools, request): """Filter out pools with VDPA devices, unless these are required. This is necessary as vdpa devices require sepcial handeling and should not be allocated to generic pci device requests. :param pools: A list of PCI device pool dicts :param request: An InstancePCIRequest object describing the type, quantity and required NUMA affinity of device(s) we want. :returns: A list of pools that can be used to support the request if this is possible. """ if all( spec.get('dev_type') != fields.PciDeviceType.VDPA for spec in request.spec ): pools = [ pool for pool in pools if not pool.get('dev_type') == fields.PciDeviceType.VDPA ] return pools @classmethod # If we're not requesting PFs then we should not use these. # If we're not requesting VDPA devices then we should not use these. # Exclude them. before_count = after_count pools = cls._filter_pools_for_unrequested_vdpa_devices(pools, request) after_count = sum([pool['count'] for pool in pools]) if after_count < before_count: LOG.debug( 'Dropped %d devices as they are VDPA devices which we have ' 'not requested', before_count - after_count )
deleted_lines: elif pci_dev.dev_type == fields.PciDeviceType.SRIOV_VF: # Finally, if we're not requesting PFs then we should not use these.

This patchset adds configuration support for network logging
when the OVN driver is enabled.

Signed-off-by: Flavio Fernandes <flaviof@redhat.com>

commit_message:
DNM: Configure a neutron tempest job to use secure RBAC

This commits adds a neutron tempest job to configure neutron to enforce
the new secure RBAC policies, including support for system and project
users (system-admin, system-reader, project-member, project-reader).

This isn't going to perform exhaustive protection testing of neutron
RBAC policies, but we can use it as a guide for dianosing issues with
the default policies in integrated scenarios (e.g., service-to-service
communication), or deployment issues assuming the old authorization
model.

We can continue to pursue full protection testing via a devstack/tempest
plugin, unit tests, or functional tests. This is a parallel effort to
increase confidence in a wide change across OpenStack to increase the
usability and introduce authorization consistency.

Change-Id: I50203caab0023450b5939d4be7c1af4bd70a6f05

commit_message:
[SVF] Set volume IOPS based on volume size

[Spectrum Virtualize Family] Adding support to set volume IOPS based on
the value 'iops_per_gb' and volume size and updating in volume metadata
for volume actions like creation, update, resize and retype to avoid
retype of volume for changing the throttling value.

closes bug: #1905988

Change-Id: I07fec25c1790089563f1baf6f43a67f0dacf77a7

commit_message:
Expose [workaround]/ensure_libvirt_rbd_instance_dir_cleanup

This exposes the nova workaround to remove the instance directory on
clean up when using rbd.

Change-Id: Iea47828c8022955cf0f91b891d43eff34a905174
(cherry picked from commit 6178fbf0331b7bb1531365f578c56912d67fccb0)
(cherry picked from commit cbb059620525de5afa692c72995ddce1518a2bc4)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-16 19:36:14.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/views.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/fbcab5f00e543c842292a5b379f88d62aa5a3e1a', 'message': 'instance view flavors: Load all readable flavors for instance context

The default behavior of api.nova.flavor_list is to set is_public=True.
This shows only flavors that belong to the current project or
are public cloud-wide. This is needlessly restrictive; since this
list is used for showing instance flavors (and not for creating or

commit_message:
instance view flavors: Load all readable flavors for instance context

The default behavior of api.nova.flavor_list is to set is_public=True.
This shows only flavors that belong to the current project or
are public cloud-wide. This is needlessly restrictive; since this
list is used for showing instance flavors (and not for creating or
resizing new instances) we may as well learn about as many flavors
as we can.

Bug: 1919369
Change-Id: I76ee0ba2066df8f000d3fd1149cffcd971cf5eef
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/61/780961/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Setting is_public=None here allows the API to query for all # readable flavors, not just those 'allowed' for the current # project. This is useful to provide context for instances # that have been orphaned by the removal of a private flavor. flavors = api.nova.flavor_list(self.request, is_public=None)

commit_message:
Add QoS Suport for Pure Storage

Add back-end QoS support for Pure Storage.
Two parameters are supported:
maxIOPS - maximum IOPS per volume - range 100 -100M
maxBWS - maximum I/O bandwidth in MB/s - range 1 - 524288

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint pure-backend-qos

Change-Id: I7f548b1aa1285499b5835fc2ebba3b6e55d8fb15
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/67/727267/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: QoS support for the Pure Storage drivers include the ability to set the following capabilities in the OpenStack Block Storage API ``cinder.api.contrib.qos_spec_manage`` qos specs extension module: * **maxIOPS** - The maximum number of IOPs allowed for this volume. Range: 100 - 100M * **maxBWS** - The maximum I/O bandwidth rate limit in MB/s. Range: 1 - 524288 (512GB/s) The qos keys above must be created and asscoiated to a volume type. For information on how to set the key-value pairs and associate them with a volume type see the `volume qos <https://docs.openstack.org/python-openstackclient/latest/cli/command-objects/volume-qos.html>`_ section in the OpenStack Client command list.

commit_message:
Stop barbican servics in unupgraded controllers

This change makes barbican services on unupgrade controller nodes get
stopped, because all services in the unupgrade controllers should be
stopped before we start the upgraded controller[1].

[1] 8529ce60da84d2aa1e1c9e6994303678261b09da

Change-Id: I7031064b752450bacbb7775c0e357b98210a8929
(cherry picked from commit 6f140b93be8349eddb7e6cd86116ab1b3f34140a)
(cherry picked from commit c996c85caea5ac098c6d57066c144adb05354c49)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/20/780820/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: external_upgrade_tasks: - when: - step|int == 1 tags: - never - system_upgrade_transfer_data - system_upgrade_stop_services block: - name: Stop barbican api container import_role: name: tripleo_container_stop vars: tripleo_containers_to_stop: - barbican_api tripleo_delegate_to: "{{ groups['barbican_api'] | default([]) }}"

subject: Use application_name by default for creating pools
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-17 02:22:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charms.openstack/commit/0f9388cf3bec5b887aa7254ef09fb0b319f67a7e', 'message': "Use application_name by default for creating pools

Charms consuming Ceph storage typically follow the convention that
pools are named for the application rather than the service name. Most
charms also allow for the pool name to be defined via a config option.
Charms which inherit from the BaseOpenStackCephCharm class will not
follow this typical behavior as the pool created is based on the charm
name.

This change updates the create_pool function to allow for a concrete
charm to optionally provide the name of the pool to be created,
defaulting to the application_name if one is not provided. This is a
change in behavior as the previous behavior was to use the charm
class's name property. Reviewing all known charms which inherit
from/mixin the BaseOpenStackCephCharm reveals that Gnocchi is the only
user of the create_pool method.

As such, it stands to reason that a change in behavior is safe in this
context since the charm class's name for gnocchi was set to the
'gnocchi' which is also the typical application name.

Change-Id: I1756ff4e1362fbc7584551249c583f8d3cb0c8dc

commit_message:
Use application_name by default for creating pools

Charms consuming Ceph storage typically follow the convention that
pools are named for the application rather than the service name. Most
charms also allow for the pool name to be defined via a config option.
Charms which inherit from the BaseOpenStackCephCharm class will not
follow this typical behavior as the pool created is based on the charm
name.

This change updates the create_pool function to allow for a concrete
charm to optionally provide the name of the pool to be created,
defaulting to the application_name if one is not provided. This is a
change in behavior as the previous behavior was to use the charm
class's name property. Reviewing all known charms which inherit
from/mixin the BaseOpenStackCephCharm reveals that Gnocchi is the only
user of the create_pool method.

As such, it stands to reason that a change in behavior is safe in this
context since the charm class's name for gnocchi was set to the
'gnocchi' which is also the typical application name.

Change-Id: I1756ff4e1362fbc7584551249c583f8d3cb0c8dc
Closes-Bug: #1918821
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charms.openstack refs/changes/00/781000/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove neutron_tempest_plugin.scenario.test_port_forwardings from skiplist

Removed below tests from skiplist
1. neutron_tempest_plugin.scenario.test_port_forwardings.PortForwarding
   TestJSON.test_port_forwarding_editing_and_deleting_udp_rule
2. neutron_tempest_plugin.scenario.test_port_forwardings.PortForwardingT
   estJSON.test_port_forwarding_to_2_servers

Bug link: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1918597

Closes-Bug: #1918597
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest/+/780588
Change-Id: Ia09abf75edf8a16a4bb80d4f0b28a8818439df03

commit_message:
Add support for custom grafana dashboards

Allow users to import custom grafana dashboards.
Dashboards as JSON files should be placed into
"{{ node_custom_config }}/grafana/dashboards/" folder.

Change-Id: Id0f83b8d08541b3b74649f097b10c9450201b426
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/28/768228/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Import Grafana extra dashboards if exists uri: method: POST url: "{{ grafana_internal_endpoint }}/api/dashboards/db" user: "{{ grafana_admin_username }}" password: "{{ grafana_admin_password }}" body_format: json body: > { "dashboard": {{ lookup("file", item) }}, "overwrite": true, "message": "Deployed with kolla-ansible" } force_basic_auth: true changed_when: True when: - item is defined with_fileglob: - "{{ node_custom_config }}/grafana/dashboards/*.json"

commit_message:
[docker] Added a new flag to disable default network

Docker is using 172.17.0.0/16 by default for bridge networking on
docker0, and this might cause routing problems for operator networks.

This change introduces docker_disable_default_network to disable the
bridge networking by putting "bridge: none"[1] to daemon.json

Bridge networking does not work without iptables, so we set the default
for docker_disable_default_network to
docker_disable_default_iptables_rules.

For better defaults, this feature will be enabled by default in
Wallaby.

[1] https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/commandline/dockerd/

Change-Id: Ic745300b27e50132d80d03787fa4abfada2d0173
Closes-Bug: #1848249
Related-Bug: #1849275

commit_message:
Install nmap on the Redhat 8 and Debian

Nmap provides ncat tool which is required e.g. by
neutron_tempest_plugin.scenario.test_port_forwarding tests.

Closes-bug: #1918597
Change-Id: I2e5b677bedfbb33518b3b655a49eaffb065f0534

don't use the same CIDR in octavia_amp_network_cidr and init-run-once

Currently kolla-ansible uses the same CIDR in init-run-once script
and for octavia_amp_network_cidr.

commit_message:
Don't require heat client for generate_passwords

To support using ephemeral heat, don't require a heat client in the
generate_passwords function. Reading the existing values from the
environment is now not required when using ephemeral heat.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id47d6ff94edfb607eb3611aa4cd306c3de450fb4

commit_message:
[doc] Add initial system-scoped text to secure-rbac

I never got around to adding in an initial pass on system scoped
interaction and use with secure rbac. This change adds a high level
overview to help explain the context.

Change-Id: I4dca32c882f484e75378aca8bb043ebd078a13cf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/44/778044/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: System scoped authentication is intended for "administrative" activites such as those crossing tenants/projects, as all tenants/projects should be visible to ``system`` scoped users in Ironic. System scoped requests do not have an associated ``project_id`` value for the Keystone request authorization token utilized to speak with Ironic. These requests are translated through `keystonemiddleware <https://docs.openstack.org/keystonemiddleware/latest/>`_ into values which tell Ironic what to do. Or to be more precise, tell the policy enforcement framework the information necessary to make decisions. System scoped requests very much align with the access controls of Ironic before the Secure RBAC effort. The original custom role ``baremetal_admin`` privilges are identical to a system scoped ``admin``'s privilges. Similarlly ``baremetal_reader`` is identical to a system scoped ``reader``. In these concepts, the ``admin`` is allowed to create/delete objects/items. The ``reader`` is allowed to read details about items and is intended for users who may need an account with read-only access for or front-line support purposes. In addition to these concepts, a ``member`` role exists in the Secure RBAC use model. Ironic does support this role, and in general ``member`` role users in a system scope are able to perform basic updates/changes, with the exception of special fields like those to disable cleaning.

commit_message:
Add iRMC Driver Support to DevStack Code

This commit adds logic
  * to determine whether irmc hardware type is enabled
  * (if enabled) to install python package python-scciclient & snmp
into DevStack code to support construction of Ironic environment
with iRMC supported Fujitsu server through DevStack.

Story: 2008722
Task: 42066
Change-Id: Ie50d8e4b43cdbfd8cd46333a75de20015e67829e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/11/781011/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function is_irmc_enabled { [[ -z "${IRONIC_ENABLED_HARDWARE_TYPES%%*irmc*}" ]] && return 0 return 1 } if is_irmc_enabled; then pip_install python-scciclient pysnmp fi

commit_message:
Align the indicators API with the spec

The expose-hardware-indicators spec[1] describes 3 API endpoints:
GET     /v1/nodes/<node_ident>/management/indicators
GET     /v1/nodes/<node_ident>/management/indicators/<component>
GET/PUT /v1/nodes/<node_ident>/management/indicators/<component>/<ind_ident>

What was implemented was a little bit different:
GET     /v1/nodes/<node_ident>/management/indicators
GET/PUT /v1/nodes/<node_ident>/management/indicators/<ind_ident>@<component>

This change brings the implementation back to the spec and what was
subsequently documented[2]. The indicators API will now return a 404
if the requested API version is not new enough.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-specs/specs/15.0/expose-hardware-indicators.html#rest-api-impact
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/baremetal/#indicators-management

Change-Id: Idcf0ec5cbf04dddf28fba6b4dc523121cd223ee5
Story: 2005342
Task: 30291

kwargs.get('name') component = kwargs.get('component') unique_name = kwargs.get('unique_name') if name and component: self.unique_name = name + '@' + component self.name = name self.component = component elif unique_name: try: index = unique_name.index('@') except ValueError: raise exception.InvalidParameterValue( _('Malformed indicator name "%s"') % unique_name) self.component = unique_name[index + 1:] self.name = unique_name[:index] self.unique_name = unique_name else: raise exception.MissingParameterValue( _('Missing indicator name "%s"')) '%s/management/indicators/%s' % ( node_uuid, rpc_name)), '%s/management/indicators/%s' % ( node_uuid, rpc_name),def indicator_list_from_dict(node_ident, indicators): for component, names in indicators.items(): for name, fields in names.items(): indicator_at_component = IndicatorAtComponent( component=component, name=name) indicator = indicator_convert_with_links( node_ident, component, indicator_at_component.unique_name, **fields) indicator_list.append(indicator) def put(self, node_ident, indicator, state): rpc_node = api_utils.get_rpc_node(node_ident) indicator_at_component = logical name of a node. :param indicator: Indicator ID (as reported by `get_supported_indicators`). :returns: a dict with the "state" key and one of mod:`ironic.common.indicator_states` as a value. """ api_utils.check_policy('baremetal:node:get_indicator_state') rpc_node = api_utils.get_rpc_node(node_ident) topic = pecan.request.rpcapi.get_topic_for(rpc_node) indicator_at_component = IndicatorAtComponent(unique_name=indicator) state = pecan.request.rpcapi.get_indicator_state( pecan.request.context, rpc_node.uuid, indicator_at_component.component, indicator_at_component.name, topic=topic) return {'state': state} @METRICS.timer('IndicatorController.get_all') @method.expose() @args.validate(node_ident=args.uuid_or_name) def get_all(self, node_ident, **kwargs): """Get node hardware components and their indicators. :param node_ident: the UUID or logical name of a node. :returns: A json object of hardware components (:mod:`ironic.common.components`) as keys with indicator IDs (from `get_supported_indicators`) as values. """ api_utils.check_policy('baremetal:node:get_indicator_state') rpc_node = api_utils.get_rpc_node(node_ident) topic = pecan.request.rpcapi.get_topic_for(rpc_node) indicators = pecan.request.rpcapi.get_supported_indicators( pecan.request.context, rpc_node.uuid, topic=topic) return indicator_list_from_dict( node_ident, indicators) def put(self, node_ident): :param node_ident: the UUID or logical name of a node. 'baremetal:node:inject_nmi', node_ident) boot_device = BootDeviceController() """Expose boot_device as a sub-element of management""" inject_nmi = InjectNmiController() """Expose inject_nmi as a sub-element of management""" indicators = IndicatorController() """Expose indicators as a sub-element of management""" management = NodeManagementController() """Expose management as a sub-element of nodes"""

commit_message:
Designate rndc configuration

Distribute rndc key generation across worker nodes.

Note: this uses a single key for all hosts, but that might change in the
future. Not sure what that would look like though.

Change-Id: I3383c19f80e70553ae71e644a01dda0f250d19da

commit_message:
Temporary fix for docs job

The docs job is failing because it is grabbing the most recent
SQLAlchemy release (1.4.0), which has removed a function we are
still using (even though it was deprecated in 0.9 -- yep, this
is our fault).

Try to avoid this by specifying SQLAlchemy in doc/req.txt and
hoping the upper-constraints will prevent pip from installing
an unconstrained version of SQLAlchemy.  This will also keep the
requirements job happy (which it is not if we have <1.4.0 in
doc/req.txt).

Change-Id: Ibd61b84f23b6d3023af107f6e3cc4d3b445025bf
Related-bug: #1832164

commit_message:
Add idle configs for nl02-04.opendev.org

These configs will allow us to bring up the nodepool-launcher service on
new focal nodepool launcher nodes in an idle state. Once we are happy
with them in the idle state we will land the next change which flips the
old hosts to idle and puts these new servers in production.

Change-Id: I0d0a30c49c1336b33dd969b039544e10d98dad0e

commit_message:
Set changed_when to false for group_by tasks

This trivial patch is just turning off ansible
changed report for group_by tasks as it could
be confusing for user.

Change-Id: I7512af573782359a6f01290a55291ac7eb0de867

commit_message:
Fix tox -e pep8

pycodestyle 2.7.0 causes flake8 to break unless
using a sufficiently new version of flake8.

Change-Id: I01bdb2d2bd74a8b236b7e71471759e1a8fd59511

subject: Ensure resource_provider_bandwitdhs is unset by default
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-11 23:03:29.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/agents/ml2/sriov.pp', 'spec/classes/neutron_agents_ml2_ovs_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/neutron_agents_ml2_sriov_spec.rb', 'manifests/agents/ml2/ovs.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron/commit/ff23708ef47baa9cb67c0afa30edb1ec5c6da802', 'message': "Ensure resource_provider_bandwitdhs is unset by default

Currently puppet-neutron supports the resource_provider_bandwidths
parameter for ovs agent and sriov agent, but it doesn't provide the way
to clear existing settings.

This change makes sure that the resource_provider_bandwiths parameter
is unset by default so that operators can reset the parameter to
the default value defined in neutron service itself.

Change-Id: Icd834f4f4ca6578c836935614931af2a3e79bf7d
(cherry picked from commit 5b7bc9f4f93231a321adba920f9778e447ceb0cf)
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure resource_provider_bandwitdhs is unset by default

Currently puppet-neutron supports the resource_provider_bandwidths
parameter for ovs agent and sriov agent, but it doesn't provide the way
to clear existing settings.

This change makes sure that the resource_provider_bandwiths parameter
is unset by default so that operators can reset the parameter to
the default value defined in neutron service itself.

Change-Id: Icd834f4f4ca6578c836935614931af2a3e79bf7d
(cherry picked from commit 5b7bc9f4f93231a321adba920f9778e447ceb0cf)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/78/780078/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Validate status for external stack resource

Allow validate status for external stack resource. If status under
FAILED, IN_PROGRESS, or DELETE_COMPLETE, will raise
StackValidationFailed.
Story: #1764947

Change-Id: Ie6626d1b2edd3464a2c774f768d39c850605393c

commit_message:
Further updates to irrelevant-files across templates

As part of [1] this further updates the irrelevant-files definitions
so that multinode jobs are not run for changes in standalone, ovb,
undercloud or upgrade specific featuresets.

Also adds missing upgrades-jobs-templates to undercloud jobs
irrelevant-files and multinode-jobs template to upgrade jobs.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce

Change-Id: Ib40ce6df06cfad7de7ab3845c1e471c3383583a7

commit_message:
Fix systemd notify unit test on macos

MacOS does not support the abstract socket addressing [1] used by
test_systemd_notify, so the test previously failed on MacOS. With this
patch the test using an abstract address is only attempted on linux
platforms. An additional test is added for all platforms that binds
the socket to a filesystem path.

[1] https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/unix.7.html

Change-Id: Ibb77995cc4fcd95bfbfbf0095a4b7f166c436eb4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/80/780680/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove references to unsupported operating systems

All references to Gentoo, SUSE, Debian stretch and Centos-7  are removed.
Conditional tasks, ternary operators and variables are simplified where possible
OS specific variables files are generalised where possible

Depends-On: Ia88b8e606a19ad8ee20665e125df1079b0a771ff
Change-Id: I88c4317a711ec9c8e00b13a2f4deede1e53830b1

commit_message:
Create OSA-specific tempest resources

This patch is part of a set that aims to break out tempest
resource creation from the role, and introduces the
tempest_default_role_resources var. When true, default role
resources are created. When false, deployer-specific resources
must be created prior to executing os-tempest-install.yml or
including the os_tempest role in other playbooks.

With this patch, OSA-specific tempest resources are created
rather than role defaults.

Change-Id: Idd7f4863442a5f686adadc67dbdea452fb57654c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/94/733894/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ## Implement OSA tempest resources rather than role defaults tempest_default_role_resources: no

commit_message:
Updating sriov_config service to run after openibd service

When having sriov configured in mlnx interfaces and we are using MLNX
ofed, it will install openibd and in reboot case we'll have a race between
sriov_config service and that openibd service which loads mlx drivers,
sometimes it causes failures in starting sriov_config service.
So updating sriov_config service to run after openibd service if it's
present, if not as in default case, systemd ignores it.

Closes-Bug: #1918255
Change-Id: I047e3c40815b71de10e6641c1d39b29de563d8d2
(cherry picked from commit 012b58ccc1623945c4428e82eec80b2f3f22d6b7)

commit_message:
Drop baymodel_chk_2 constraints for old DB migration

Magnum cannot be used with MySQL 8.0 because it tries
to rename a column used by a constraint.

See the error in this paste [1] that occurs when trying
to deploy Magnum on Ubuntu Focal (20.04) where MySQL
now defaults to 8.0

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/800060/

Change-Id: I72dd274150c17b75fd8b86dc62fa269a27f41bce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/61/762861/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from sqlalchemy.engine.reflection import Inspector bind = op.get_bind() inspector = Inspector.from_engine(bind) existing_cks = [ c['name'] for c in inspector.get_check_constraints('baymodel') ] if "baymodel_chk_2" in existing_chks: op.drop_constraint("baymodel_chk_2", "baymodel", type_="check")

Currently puppet-neutron supports the resource_provider_bandwidths

commit_message:
Ensure resource_provider_bandwitdhs is unset by default

Currently puppet-neutron supports the resource_provider_bandwidths
parameter for ovs agent and sriov agent, but it doesn't provide the way
to clear existing settings.

This change makes sure that the resource_provider_bandwiths parameter
is unset by default so that operators can reset the parameter to
the default value defined in neutron service itself.

Change-Id: Icd834f4f4ca6578c836935614931af2a3e79bf7d
(cherry picked from commit 5b7bc9f4f93231a321adba920f9778e447ceb0cf)
(cherry picked from commit ff23708ef47baa9cb67c0afa30edb1ec5c6da802)
(cherry picked from commit e77d34f037559fee522ac8811e07b3416f94e26e)

commit_message:
Fix up the principal name in ovn-dbs-pacemaker-puppet

Via Ib868465c20d97c62cbcb214bfc62d949bd6efc62 this got erroneously
renamed to ovn_controller:
git show e329ca915ebf | grep ovn_dbs |grep template
-    template: "ovn_dbs/%{hiera('fqdn_NETWORK')}"

Let's restore that to its previous name.

Change-Id: I70fadf7921b424f956f78f0b727a0c12efbe2bfe

commit_message:
Revert "Use ussuri branch for tinyipa check job for ussuri"

This reverts commit 166840a3fdd3221c5b3c9973b68cd03c6a7862fc.

Reason for revert: ipa-builder needs to be pinned at 2.2.0 but the override-checkout to ussuri blocks that

commit_message:
Remove references to unsupported operating systems

All references to Gentoo, SUSE, Debian stretch and Centos-7  are removed.
Conditional tasks, ternary operators and variables are simplified where possible
OS specific variables files are generalised where possible

Change-Id: Ic1b8b532adec2c46373d3a0a3cea8387bff7817a

commit_message:
Update cirros image to cirros-0.5.2-x86_64

Due to this change I12e0bdb3699e5343592ab834468ba6b2fcdcaaf4
our integration job is failing. This patch update cirror image
version to fix our CI.

commit_message:
Pin neutron, keystone and cinder tempest plugins to py2 compatible versions where needed

On the OSA Train branch, Centos-7 deploys with python2 and the other
operating systems use python3. Debian stable (stretch) uses python
3.5.

This patch pins the tempest plugin versions to ones which support
python2.7 and 3.5 or later.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/780562
Change-Id: I4c9793aaeca46e2e0b7528de8fa0dc222803debb

subject: Sharding: Moving to active state sets state_timestamp
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-16 06:04:16.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/container/test_sharder.py', 'test/unit/cli/test_manage_shard_ranges.py', 'swift/container/sharder.py', 'swift/container/backend.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/189eba187ed827c6d1d3338c48dba37e650c6f46', 'message': "Sharding: Moving to active state sets state_timestamp

Be need to be able to know when a shard has moved into the ACTIVE state,
currently there isn't an easy way to figure that for root and sharding
shards. We do have a state_timestamp, but it's used when we need to push
something backwards in the state machine.

But turns out everytime we use that we also set an epoch. Except for
when we set ACITIVE of root containers when they're eligible acceptors.
But in that case, a root already has an epoch. Epoch's are related the
toe filename of the database, however, only the Timestamp.normal value
is used for this. This means we can use timestamp offsets to indicate an
epoch update in the root for collapsing.

What does this mean, it means we can start using epochs to make sure
late ACTIVE state changes (from a node that was down) can't break
something that has since moved back or forward in the state machine.

Change-Id: If71bba48769e9f5b6c51e0d6ccf86d6abee41600
"}]
commit_message:
Sharding: Moving to active state sets state_timestamp

Be need to be able to know when a shard has moved into the ACTIVE state,
currently there isn't an easy way to figure that for root and sharding
shards. We do have a state_timestamp, but it's used when we need to push
something backwards in the state machine.

But turns out everytime we use that we also set an epoch. Except for
when we set ACITIVE of root containers when they're eligible acceptors.
But in that case, a root already has an epoch. Epoch's are related the
toe filename of the database, however, only the Timestamp.normal value
is used for this. This means we can use timestamp offsets to indicate an
epoch update in the root for collapsing.

What does this mean, it means we can start using epochs to make sure
late ACTIVE state changes (from a node that was down) can't break
something that has since moved back or forward in the state machine.

Change-Id: If71bba48769e9f5b6c51e0d6ccf86d6abee41600

commit_message:
Fix provider driver quota handling

When provider drivers registered a load balancer object delete,
the driver agent was not decrementing the project quota.
This patch corrects that by decrementing the proper quota
when a DELETED status is received from the provider driver.

Conflicts:
    octavia/tests/unit/api/drivers/driver_agent/test_driver_updater.py

Change-Id: I7d705c9f4f0217c6fbe332f45b15892bf1d4a90b

commit_message:
Clean port forwarding cache when router is DOWN

Port forwarding L3 agent extension needs to clean cache when
router is DOWN, otherwise the port forwarding extension will
skip all objects processing when router is UP again, because
the cache is hitting.

This patch addresses this issue.

Change-Id: Idd65f1eda020ada9a76c39904efa8d55680d9e6b
Closes-bug: #1917393
(cherry picked from commit 058214670820be6f40e8ab05c0e1dbe8dc389abc)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/77/779777/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(pf.PortForwardingAgentExtension, '_sending_port_forwarding_fip_status') @mock.patch.object(iptables_manager.IptablesTable, 'add_rule') @mock.patch.object(iptables_manager.IptablesTable, 'add_chain') @mock.patch.object(l3router.RouterInfo, 'add_floating_ip') def test_add_delete_router(self, mock_add_fip, mock_add_chain, mock_add_rule, mock_send_fip_status): # simulate the router add and already there is a port forwarding # resource association. mock_add_fip.return_value = lib_const.FLOATINGIP_STATUS_ACTIVE self.fip_pf_ext.add_router(self.context, self.router) self._assert_called_iptables_process( mock_add_chain, mock_add_rule, mock_add_fip, mock_send_fip_status, target_obj=self.portforwarding1) router_fip_ids = self.fip_pf_ext.mapping.router_fip_mapping.get( self.router['id']) self.assertIsNotNone(router_fip_ids) for fip_id in router_fip_ids: pf_ids = self.fip_pf_ext.mapping.fip_port_forwarding.get(fip_id) self.assertIsNotNone(pf_ids) for pf_id in pf_ids: pf = self.fip_pf_ext.mapping.managed_port_forwardings.get( pf_id) self.assertIsNotNone(pf) self.fip_pf_ext.delete_router(self.context, self.router) self.assertIsNone( self.fip_pf_ext.mapping.router_fip_mapping.get(self.router['id']))

commit_message:
Hidden property `personality` and mark it as invalid

``personality`` property of ``OS::Nova::Server`` is now Hidden.
Heat will not support it now. Please use ``user_data``
or ``metadata`` instead.

Change-Id: I95005f25134aa8fb44c3029d22c12bfd32bc0676
Task: #27678

commit_message:
Use -dev version for galaxy in git repo

When installing collections from git[1] the version should be
higher than the released one, but lower than next release can be.
Use "-dev" for set version between two releases in git repo, so
installing from git won't require --force.

[1] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/devel/user_guide/
collections_using.html#installing-a-collection-from-a-git-repository
Change-Id: I86f292fde0cb6eaa75908794fe0c997e4bca7aee

commit_message:
Use single NovaLibvirtNetwork to configure instance console components

Nova vnc configuration right now uses NovaVncProxyNetwork,
NovaLibvirtNetwork and NovaApiNetwork to configure the different
components (novnc proxy, nova-compute and libvirt) for vnc.
If one of the networks get changed from internal_api, the service
configuration between libvirt, nova-compute and novnc proxy gets
inconsistent and the console is broken.
This changed to just use NovaLibvirtNetwork for configuring the vnc
endpoints and removes NovaVncProxyNetwork completely.

Change-Id: Icef2481b65b41b524ad44eeecfbee4451006e1d2
Closes-Bug: #1917719

commit_message:
Add deployed_port template

Add a new deployed_port template which will replace
the current neutron port templates when ports are
managed outside of the heat stack.

Partial-Implements: blueprint network-data-v2-ports
Change-Id: Ia71b74e80122e6a12d4f88a90ede02d39763914e

commit_message:
Remove references to unsupported operating systems

All references to Gentoo, SUSE, Debian stretch and Centos-7  are removed.
Conditional tasks, ternary operators and variables are simplified where possible
OS specific variables files are generalised where possible

Change-Id: I8224deceba331d9fbca64c151b27430530a18528

commit_message:
CentOS 8: Make it clearer the 7 to 8 migration stays on Train

In response to a mailing list post [1] trying to go from Train on CentOS
7 to Ussuri on CentOS 8.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/021129.html

Change-Id: I3cc958665d9eb0d47c2f31e2c75bd7a3b1f64aea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/47/781047/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This section describes how to migrate an existing Train deployment from CentOS 7 to CentOS 8.Note that in a multi-node system on the Train release it is possible to have a mix of CentOS 7 and CentOS 8 hosts while the migration takes place.
deleted_lines: This section describes how to migrate an existing deployment from CentOS 7 to CentOS 8.Note that in a multi-node system it is possible to have a mix of CentOS 7 and CentOS 8 hosts while the migration takes place.

Update setuptools to match version in upper-constraints

defaults to the latest version of pip, which has a stricter
resolver.

commit_message:
Update iDRAC doc on Redfish vendor passthru interface

Change-Id: I6ebbfd5a4b42ad0c8321b59e2a07fcc9829115bd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/21/779221/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * `Vendor Interface`_: BIOS management (WSMAN) and eject virtual media (Redfish) enabled_vendor_interfaces=idrac-redfish``vendor`` ``idrac-wsman``, ``idrac``, ``idrac-redfish``, ``no-vendor`` --vendor-interface idrac-redfishidrac-wsman ----------- Dell iDRAC BIOS management is available through the Ironic WSMAN vendor^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^The boot mode can be changed via the WSMAN vendor passthru interface as follows:idrac-redfish ------------- Through the ``idrac-redfish`` vendor passthru interface these methods are available: ================ ============ ============================================== Method Name HTTP Method Description ================ ============ ============================================== ``eject_media`` ``POST`` Eject a virtual media device. If no device is provided then all attached devices will be ejected. Optional argument: ``boot_device`` - the boot device to eject, either, ``cd``, ``dvd``, ``usb`` or ``floppy``. ================ ============ ============================================== WSMAN vendor passthru timeout ----------------------------- When iDRAC is not ready and executing WSMAN vendor passthru commands, they take more time as waiting for iDRAC to become ready again and then time out, for example:
deleted_lines: * `Vendor Interface`_: BIOS management enabled_vendor_interfaces=idrac-wsman``vendor`` ``idrac-wsman``, ``idrac``, ``no-vendor`` --vendor-interface no-vendorDell iDRAC BIOS management is available through the Ironic vendor------------------------The boot mode can be changed via the vendor passthru interface as follows:Vendor passthru timeout ----------------------- When iDRAC is not ready and executing vendor passthru commands, they take more time as waiting for iDRAC to become ready again and then time out, for example:

commit_message:
ETSI-NFV SOL 001 translation: AffinityRule

The current heat-translator supports several conversions of
resources defined in ETSI NFV-SOL 001[1].
This patch supports the conversion of new resource types.
Specifically, the following types related to
'PlacementConstraints'.
- tosca.groups.nfv.PlacementGroup
- tosca.policies.nfv.AffinityRule
- tosca.policies.nfv.AntiAffinityRule

[1] https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_gs/NFV-SOL/001_099/001/02.06.01_60/gs_NFV-SOL001v020601p.pdf

Co-Authored-By: Hiroo Kitamura hiroo.kitamura@ntt-at.co.jp
Implements: blueprint support-placement-constraints
Change-Id: Ic22a6183ee0d7c8357063bdafbb1a11c1a6efa3c

commit_message:
Fix processing related to required properties

In the current UT testcase and yaml, there are several cases where
the required property of policy is insufficient or the definition
part is incorrect.
In addition, there is a bug in the code that has the translation
logic under 'translator/hot/tosca/'.
This patch fixes these translation logic codes, testcase and yaml.

Among the fixed yaml files, the following has a line feed code of CRLF,
so it has been modified to LF.

* translator/tests/data/autoscaling/tosca_cluster_autoscaling.yaml
* translator/tests/data/custom_types/senlin_cluster_policies.yaml
* translator/tests/data/nfv/test_tosca_nfv_autoscaling_with_params.yaml

In addition, NOTE description is added for
'translator/hot/tosca/tosca_policies_monitoring.py',
which is one of the translation logic codes.

Closes-Bug: #1918360
Change-Id: Ib9dec61007db5d354eaca86000ab3bcf6744a838

subject: swift-manage-shard-ranges: check for internal gaps
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-17 05:49:28.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/utils.py', 'swift/cli/manage_shard_ranges.py', 'swift/container/sharder.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/bd9a46c5433807f53bbc1283f19f0a261e2da61b', 'message': 'swift-manage-shard-ranges: check for internal gaps

Currently the ShardRangeList.includes method only checks the lower and
upper of the list, which means it can only check for gaps at the start
and end of a list. But fails to check for any gaps internal to the list.

We already have a find_missing_ranges helper method that searches for
gaps, so move it into utils and start using it to give us better gap
checking.

Change-Id: I5f0a32325791e91b80ee4541e3e92ceb452a7661
'}]
commit_message:
swift-manage-shard-ranges: check for internal gaps

Currently the ShardRangeList.includes method only checks the lower and
upper of the list, which means it can only check for gaps at the start
and end of a list. But fails to check for any gaps internal to the list.

We already have a find_missing_ranges helper method that searches for
gaps, so move it into utils and start using it to give us better gap
checking.

Change-Id: I5f0a32325791e91b80ee4541e3e92ceb452a7661
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/13/781013/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class TestFindMissingRanges(unittest.TestCase): def setUp(self): self.ts_iter = make_timestamp_iter() self.t1 = next(self.ts_iter) self.shard_ranges = [ utils.ShardRange('a/b', self.t1, 'a', 'b', object_count=2, bytes_used=22), utils.ShardRange('b/c', self.t1, 'b', 'c', object_count=4, bytes_used=44), utils.ShardRange('c/d', self.t1, 'c', 'd', object_count=6, bytes_used=66), utils.ShardRange('d/e', self.t1, 'd', 'e', object_count=6, bytes_used=66), utils.ShardRange('e/f', self.t1, 'e', 'f', object_count=6, bytes_used=66), utils.ShardRange('f/g', self.t1, 'f', 'g', object_count=6, bytes_used=66),] def _do_test(self, shard_ranges, minimum, maximum, expected_gaps): gaps = utils.find_missing_ranges(shard_ranges, minimum, maximum) self.assertEqual(gaps, expected_gaps) def test_find_missing_ranges(self): # first test with MIN and MAX. These are missing from self.shard_ranges expected_gaps = [(utils.ShardRange.MIN, 'a'), ('g', utils.ShardRange.MAX)] self._do_test(self.shard_ranges, utils.ShardRange.MIN, utils.ShardRange.MAX, expected_gaps) # but should be ok if we pass in our shard_ranges min and max self._do_test(self.shard_ranges, 'a', 'g', []) for i in range(len(self.shard_ranges)): tmp_ranges = list(self.shard_ranges) missing = tmp_ranges.pop(i) expected_gap = [(missing.lower, missing.upper)] self._do_test(tmp_ranges, 'a', 'g', expected_gap) def test_find_gaps(self): # If you don't provide a lower or upper then it'll use self.lower and # self.upper.. so any gaps at the start or end will be missed. gaps = 0 for i in range(len(self.shard_ranges)): tmp_ranges = list(self.shard_ranges) tmp_ranges.pop(i) srl = ShardRangeList(tmp_ranges) if srl.find_gaps(): gaps += 1 self.assertEqual(1, gaps) # However, if we supply an upper or lower we'll find gaps at the # beginning and end for i in range(len(self.shard_ranges)): tmp_ranges = list(self.shard_ranges) missing = tmp_ranges.pop(i) expected_gap = [(missing.lower, missing.upper)] srl = ShardRangeList(tmp_ranges) self.assertEqual(srl.find_gaps('a', 'y'), expected_gap)

commit_message:
[PowerFlex] manage volume snapshot improvements

PowerFlex driver does not use openstack volume id as its volume name (or
part of its volume name) due to length limitation. It converts the
cinder uuid to an internal name less than 32 chars and maps this name to
an internal id which is a 16-byte hexadecimal number. Most PowerFlex
volume operations require the internal id, like volume/snapshot manage.

There're 2 conversions:
1. flex_utils.id_to_base64: Openstack cinder volume/snapshot uuid ->
PowerFlex volume name
2. queryIdByKey: PowerFlex volume name -> PowerFlex internal id.

Since all this happens inside PowerFlex driver, there's no way for
tempest to know the PowerFlex internal name or id, thus tempest
volume/snapshot manage cases fail.

This change is to make PowerFlex accept 3 types of source-id so that
PowerFlex volume/snapshot manage is more user-friendly.
1. Openstack volume/snapshot uuid
2. PowerFlex internal name
3. PowerFlex internal id

commit_message:
Assign all aggregates to reserved_host

This patch fixes the code that assignes aggregates to the reserved_host.
The existing code only assigned a aggregate that first matched failed
compute host name.
By this fix, all aggregates that ware assigned to the failed host can
be assigned to the reserved_host.

Closes-Bug: #1856164
Change-Id: I8a727e3c50b71a5ad52d58d0ba3bde4f09446748

commit_message:
Improve TLS explanation

Better explain how applications get TLS-enabled,
the cloud database in particular.

Change-Id: I8cb74c7cc8ddde61f86544db8feedf25253a5496
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-deployment-guide refs/changes/80/780980/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Cloud applications are TLS-enabled via the ``vault:certificates`` relation and the first application to be enabled should be the cloud database. Although the latter has a built-in self-signed CA certificate, it is recommended to use the one in Vault: .. code-block:: none juju add-relation mysql-innodb-cluster:certificates vault:certificates

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-16 14:55:27.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/glance/glance-api-container-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/swift/swift-proxy-container-puppet.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/33b47f47926f504a1799c7de60ae88e489c1f455', 'message': 'Fix start order for {swift_proxy,glance_api}_tls_proxy

commit_message:
Fix start order for {swift_proxy,glance_api}_tls_proxy

In stack updates adding TLS to Swift would not work because
swift_proxy_tls_proxy is started when the pre-existing
swift_proxy container is still up and listening on the TCP port
which should instead be used by swift_proxy_tls_proxy

This change ensures swift_proxy_tls_proxy and glance_api_tls_proxy
containers are started after the actual swift_proxy and glance_api
containers are started.

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
Change-Id: I980dfc54b799c6b1d648489a727a590dd26fa502
Closes-Bug: 1918642
(cherry picked from commit c8a828aab297500176d2f9e9e0b05d47d60e4645)
(cherry picked from commit a6c7ba02a969fa82473b2f670b1e8d98baf70b59)

commit_message:
Upgrade Prometheus to v2.25 change/Remove deprecated flags

The flag storage.tsdb.retention is deprecated and generates warnings
on startup storage.tsdb.retention.time is the new flag.

storage.tsdb.wal-compression is now set as the default in v2.20
and above and is no longer needed

Change-Id: I66f861a354a3cdde69a712ca5fd8a1d1a1eca60a

commit_message:
Add security add/update services for in-use share networks

This change adds two new commands to the client:
- 'share-network-security-service-update'
- 'share-network-security-service-update-check'
- 'share-network-security-service-add-check'
- 'share-network-reset-state'

Partially Implements: bp add-security-service-in-use-share-networks
Co-Authored-By: Carlos Eduardo <ces.eduardo98@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Andre Beltrami <debeltrami@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Douglas Viroel <viroel@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[IBM DS8000]: Fix compatability issue in get_host

get_host" checks for "os_type" and sets host type for DS8000, "os_type"
returned from python2.7 is "linux2" and from python3 is "linux". This
will lead the get_host to set the wrong host type.

Modified get_host to include "linux" in "os_type" check and removed the
"OShost" tag for host name.

Closes-Bug: #1903648
Change-Id: Ibafecf204465132d64d28102acbcc311079b65f8

commit_message:
API to force manual cleaning without booting IPA

Adds a new argument disable_ramdisk to the manual cleaning API.
Only steps that are marked with requires_ramdisk=False can be
run in this mode. Cleaning prepare/tear down is not done.

Some steps (like redfish BIOS) currently require IPA to detect
a successful reboot. They are not marked with requires_ramdisk
just yet.

Change-Id: Icacac871603bd48536188813647bc669c574de2a
Story: #2008491
Task: #41540

commit_message:
Make UpgradeInitCommand and UpgradeLeapp{ToRemove,ToInstall,CommandOptions} per-role

When specific roles are deployed with custom images, for example CephStorage with
overcloud-minimal, then the LeappCommandOptions and/or the list of packages to
be removed/installed is not the same across all roles.

This change makes four parameters to be customized on a per-role basis:
UpgradeInitCommand
UpgradeLeappToRemove
UpgradeLeappToInstall
UpgradeLeappCommandOptions

Related-Bug: 1915067
Closes-Bug: rhbz#1936419
Change-Id: Ifd373f7aba6d98baa843b141de8a2266eaa71a0b
(cherry picked from commit 155fe9454b907553a351e724da3b5ef3ce8dcb48)

subject: py36: Fix syslog fallback to UDP
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-16 17:57:47.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/utils.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/c7d56fa9c57a18473da166254c01f4abc44c7ee3', 'message': 'py36: Fix syslog fallback to UDP

With py2 the SysLogHandler would raise an error if it could not
connect to the configured log_address socket. This prompted the
utils.get_logger() method to fallback to using UDP. With py3 an error
is not raised [1], so the fallback never happens. In that scenario,
exceptions are raised when swift services are started and attempt to
log.

This patch modifies get_logger() to test if the log_address is a socket
before instantiating a SysLogHandler and fallback to UDP if not a socket.

[1] https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/master/Lib/logging/handlers.py#L833-L842

Change-Id: Ic099fdc3925bf99f8528c7aa763b651c19df1322
'}]
commit_message:
py36: Fix syslog fallback to UDP

With py2 the SysLogHandler would raise an error if it could not
connect to the configured log_address socket. This prompted the
utils.get_logger() method to fallback to using UDP. With py3 an error
is not raised [1], so the fallback never happens. In that scenario,
exceptions are raised when swift services are started and attempt to
log.

This patch modifies get_logger() to test if the log_address is a socket
before instantiating a SysLogHandler and fallback to UDP if not a socket.

[1] https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/master/Lib/logging/handlers.py#L833-L842

Change-Id: Ic099fdc3925bf99f8528c7aa763b651c19df1322

commit_message:
Don't specify --os-cloud undercloud (ephemeral heat)

It is not necessary to specify --os-cloud undercloud when running
openstackclient commands as the stackrc file is expected to already be
sourced.

Also, by removing the --os-cloud argument it allows the playbooks to
work when using an ephemeral Heat instance with the same command,
instead of having to use a different command depending on what type of
Heat is used.

Implements: blueprint ephemeral-heat-overcloud
Change-Id: I1e8b5e58d4464900abc7f3234e7520c44d7cb0c0

commit_message:
Add external-ceph environment file

External ceph configuration is done with tripleo
using the tripleo_ceph_client ansible role.
This change adds a new, generic environment file
that can be included in the overcloud deploy when
services using an external Ceph cluster are configured.

Change-Id: I86650396218d27250150456b023a9d3e392c2e5f

commit_message:
Set rbd default features in ceph.conf

The typical Cinder deployment should have
more than just "layering" enabled.

Enable fast-diff, which requires exclusive-lock
and object-map.

Previously, there was code that tried to enable
exclusive-lock when CEPH_ISCSI is enabled, but this
code would not work reliably, since it was doing
addition instead of bitwise-or.  Just remove it
since exclusive-lock will be enabled by default.

Change-Id: Idad98cfebf5e3b265316f2b6a3c201b472faa32c

commit_message:
Specify router name to allow co-located routers

We were getting "Error: It appears that a router instance named '' has been
previously configured in this host. If that instance no longer exists, use the
--force option to overwrite it." when co-locating mysql-routers. Specify the
name of the mysql-router to allow co-location.

Closes-Bug: #1918726
Change-Id: I65c2730dcb5ffb240bf57c9e0b0cb1a1735a4525
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-mysql-router refs/changes/30/780130/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: libvirt: Deprecate `live_migration_tunnelled`
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-16 15:52:26.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/deprecate-tunnelled-live-migration-81c06a04627724ec.yaml', 'nova/conf/libvirt.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/14071dfb118a32b26c6ebc068c66558d37466a5a', 'message': 'libvirt: Deprecate `live_migration_tunnelled`

We are well above the required MIN_LIBVIRT_VERSION and MIN_QEMU_VERSION
(4.4.0 and 2.11.0, respectively) to get QEMU-native TLS[1] support by
default.

So we can now deprecate (and later remove) the support for "tunnelled
live migration", which has two inherent limitations: (a) it cannot
handle live migration of disks in a non-shared storage setup (a.k.a.
"block migration"); and (b) it has a huge performance overhead and
latency, because it burns more CPU and memory bandwidth due to increased
number of data copies, on both source and destination hosts.

Both the above limitations are addressed by the QEMU-native TLS support
`live_migration_with_native_tls`, which is the recommended approach for
securing all live migration streams (guest RAM, device state, and
disks).

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/secure-live-migration-with-qemu-native-tls.html

Change-Id: I34fd5a4788a2ad4380d9a57b84512fa94a6f9c37
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Deprecate `live_migration_tunnelled`

We are well above the required MIN_LIBVIRT_VERSION and MIN_QEMU_VERSION
(4.4.0 and 2.11.0, respectively) to get QEMU-native TLS[1] support by
default.

So we can now deprecate (and later remove) the support for "tunnelled
live migration", which has two inherent limitations: (a) it cannot
handle live migration of disks in a non-shared storage setup (a.k.a.
"block migration"); and (b) it has a huge performance overhead and
latency, because it burns more CPU and memory bandwidth due to increased
number of data copies, on both source and destination hosts.

Both the above limitations are addressed by the QEMU-native TLS support
`live_migration_with_native_tls`, which is the recommended approach for
securing all live migration streams (guest RAM, device state, and
disks).

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/secure-live-migration-with-qemu-native-tls.html

Change-Id: I34fd5a4788a2ad4380d9a57b84512fa94a6f9c37
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/08/780908/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: deprecated_for_removal=True, deprecated_since='23.0.0', deprecated_reason=""" The "tunnelled live migration" has two inherent limitations: it cannot handle live migration of disks in a non-shared storage setup; and it has a huge performance cost. Both these problems are solved by ``live_migration_with_native_tls`` (requires a pre-configured TLS environment), which is the recommended approach for securing all live migration streams.""",

commit_message:
Skip hostname check when running in a container

To facilitate tripleo deploy running in a conatiner, the hostname check
is skipped if the "container" environment variable set. This environment
variable is set automatically by container runtimes.

The hostname check is not a useful preflight check when running tripleo
deploy in a container, and further, the hostnamectl command can't be
used since the process running inside the container is not running under
systemd.

blueprint tripleo-deploy-multinode
Change-Id: I4466ae1ce3fdd209a5281338b29287f43abdfd3a
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/95/725995/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if "container" in os.environ: logger.info('Detected running in a container, ' 'skipping hostname check') return

commit_message:
Flip nl01.openstack.org to nl01.opendev.org

This flips the active control of the rax providers from
nl01.openstack.org to nl01.opendev.org. This change should only be
landed once we are happy with the deployment of a new nl01.opendev.org
instance.

Change-Id: Idc838c3cb2d631ef684f733b564f7d4713fc3a41

commit_message:
Bump erlang version

Packagecloud repo has dropped previous erlang repo causing CentOS 7
CI to fail. We bump debian erlang version for consistency as well.

CentOS 7 jobs are set non-voting to resolve circular dependency
wich has been raised with [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest/+/779696

Change-Id: I5f70542a4632e602b2cd783c61aa074e3c8e0d57
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server refs/changes/62/780562/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add support for nova custom provider inventories

Nova supports to configure resource provider inventory and traits using a
standardized YAML file format starting victoria release [1]. This introduces
CustomProviderInventories role parameter to configure the custom provider yaml.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/managing-resource-providers.html

Depends-On: If12d7f5a8c331e051eb543f88187c31e676f3b62
Depends-On: I509eec3bf37368640ae8a3df8271b769d29f70c4
Change-Id: I25ea828397fcc968d07b0d5e87bdc9445ac690e2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/08/776508/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: [Victoria and bellow] Ensure rights on the ansible.log file
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-09 08:42:09.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/actions/ansible.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/d485407159ea6cb2c7abf6d5788d85147f433996', 'message': '[Victoria and bellow] Ensure rights on the ansible.log file

When mistral starts the Ansible action, a log file is created runtime.
But nothing takes care of its access right, leading to potential data
leaks to unprivileged users (default mode is 0644).

This patch creates the logfile beforehands, and sets the needed rights
on it.

Change-Id: Ica1b5c0a165cc06fac668513114eef2b4ba73f56
Closes-Bug: #1918138
'}]
commit_message:
[Victoria and bellow] Ensure rights on the ansible.log file

When mistral starts the Ansible action, a log file is created runtime.
But nothing takes care of its access right, leading to potential data
leaks to unprivileged users (default mode is 0644).

This patch creates the logfile beforehands, and sets the needed rights
on it.

Change-Id: Ica1b5c0a165cc06fac668513114eef2b4ba73f56
Closes-Bug: #1918138
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/38/779438/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Create the log file, and set some rights on it in order to prevent # unwanted access open(log_path, 'a').close() os.chmod(log_path, 0o640)

commit_message:
Check Ceph cluster healthy state before starting FS to BS playbook

The Ceph OSDs migration from filestore to bluestore should only be
attempted if the cluster is in HEALTH_OK state because during the
process OSDs will be destroyed and recreated.

This change adds a check to poll for the cluster status before the
playbook is triggered.

Change-Id: Ib9c90c4c2e838bed461ac63139b161ab689d28cf
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/777561
Closes-Bug: 1915700
(cherry picked from commit 5250e6d595c7ad97059930809fbeda9b17c1b364)

commit_message:
Remove third-party OVS NSH support in favor of built-in support

This patchset removes the ovs_nsh_support variable used to deploy
a custom-compiled release of Open vSwitch with NSH support in favor
of relying on built-in NSH support in recent releases of Open vSwitch[1].

[1] https://mail.openvswitch.org/pipermail/ovs-dev/2017-November/340716.html

Change-Id: If6456d2916982226bbdc5080ec58a47b6fb1ec8d

commit_message:
Remove references to unsupported operating systems

All references to Gentoo, SUSE, Debian stretch and Centos-7  are removed.
Conditional tasks, ternary operators and variables are simplified where possible
OS specific variables files are generalised where possible

Change-Id: Ibe914d0d547b930b8167bfa475cc838df8d7ae25

commit_message:
Remove references to unsupported operating systems

All references to Gentoo, SUSE, Debian stretch and Centos-7  are removed.
Conditional tasks, ternary operators and variables are simplified where possible
OS specific variables files are generalised where possible

Change-Id: I50bb0f00658e292f39269c3980109e56319a00ca

commit_message:
Remove references to unsupported operating systems

All references to Gentoo, SUSE, Debian stretch and Centos-7  are removed.
Conditional tasks, ternary operators and variables are simplified where possible
OS specific variables files are generalised where possible

Change-Id: I5e402a943fd1d923db99f04c68c5e9510d3acc85

commit_message:
Remove VFSLocalFS

The fix Iac8496065c8b6212d7edac320659444ab341b513 removed the last user
of VFSLocalFS so this patch remove the class, the related tests and all
the privsep functions that become dead code after this cleanup.

Change-Id: Ia1eb1d93d1f9699a4027b7a07107109ab9a3a29a

commit_message:
WIP: tests: Make mdev stubs work like vDPA

This is slightly cleaner, IMO, and unifies the two approaches.

WIP because I need to get hold of a real mdev-having server to update
the XML snippets. What we have now is a *huge* lie (as opposed to a
small lie).

Change-Id: I57d310a39d877f66bb017c5cd70ae90612289a4f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add tinyipa ussuri jobs

Add definitions for tinyipa ussuri jobs, we need them to point to
ipa-builder with tinycore 10.x as ussuri CI platform is still based on
ubuntu bionic and the kernel would be too old to use tinycore >= 11.x

Add a non-voting job to keep an eye on it

Change-Id: I0cadc636f7ae29dd289e4455c11c1549a02475df

commit_message:
Fix memcached restart on cert renewal

Memcached does not need to be restarted in order to reload new certs,
a single refresh_certs command will do. This fix will preserve cached
items and avoid cache rebuild.

Change-Id: Ida5faaf4685b111b3b07b4499b24d4ba3b6ec459
Depends-On: I18bda6b9219ab42543f83c46be7763f98e4dfd0e
Signed-off-by: Moiss Guimares de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/44/772344/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Send refresh_certs command to memcached memcached_ip="$(hiera -c /etc/puppet/hiera.yaml memcached::listen_ip.0 127.0.0.1)" memcached_port="$(hiera -c /etc/puppet/hiera.yaml memcached::tcp_port 11211)" echo refresh_certs | openssl s_client -connect $memcached_ip:$memcached_port
deleted_lines: # Trigger a container restart to read the new certificates $container_cli restart $container_name

commit_message:
Use stream labels on all centos 8 nodesets

As the last step of the centos-8 transition,
move all centos-8 nodesets to use centos-8
stream labels and deploy centos-8 stream nodes.

Change-Id: I174e7822059a3022089ae06917e7cca9f90cd765

commit_message:
Assume centos version is at least 8.3

Removing this check allows the same code to work on centos-8 stream
where the version is reported just as '8'.

Change-Id: Icc608500a099f51e5c44cecd1d259ff6315758f7

commit_message:
Release note change of behavior with SR-IOV and HW Acceleration

Needed-By: Id0b81848658a3bd34470440bd68928ae9f6682e4
Needed-By: I397a2a82501c565724d6fce6b49f7b68d57d47fd
Related-Bug: #1908351
Change-Id: I16572bd608d4103f2d2ed822332f68b2160607f7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-guide refs/changes/27/775827/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Runtime configuration of SR-IOV and Acceleration ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The Neutron Open vSwitch and OVN charms will no longer perform runtime configuration of SR-IOV Virtual Functions (VFs) or vendor specific hardware adaption for hardware acceleration support. To activate changes to number of SR-IOV VFs or whether hardware acceleration is enabled the operator is expected to reboot the affected units after changing the charm configuration. This change of charm behavior is necessary for two reasons: 1. Changing the number of VFs on a running system breaks connectivity to any running virtual machines. 2. For Hardware Acceleration support there is a particular order in which components of the system must be set up for successful operation. Applying or changing the configuration at runtime would involve removing any bonds configured and could also lead to NIC firmware malfunction.

commit_message:
Update glance default policy values

There was an issue with the metadef APIs in glance, detailed in
the latest OSSN[0] that they have the potential to leak resources.

This change updates the default policy for the metadef APIs to
be disabled by default.

[0] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/OSSN/OSSN-0088

Change-Id: I7377b3a2f3784fe7da78bdd7aba146328cc0f406

Remove references to unsupported operating systems

All references to Gentoo, SUSE, Debian stretch and Centos-7  are removed.
Conditional tasks, ternary operators and variables are simplified where possible
OS specific variables files are generalised where possible

commit_message:
Changed minversion in tox to 3.18.0

The patch bumps min version of tox to 3.18.0 python in order to
replace tox's whitelist_externals by allowlist_externals option:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

Change-Id: I945f20d99bc4449fed5d6510d823b1375b2af22f

commit_message:
Disable Load Balancers panel when Octavia service is not deployed

Currently Load Balancers panel is enabled based on 'network' service
defined in Keystone but it should refer to 'load-balancer' service
which is served by Octavia.

Story: #2008446
Task: #41413
Change-Id: Ia93cb7520ff9c179a27e72719f1fd10524c57acb
(cherry picked from commit 9b10ff4964d125dbd59232c52ca692c5c7fe0044)
